people.title: Director, BRITE Professional Services & Former Editor-in-Chief of IEEE IT Professional

title: A truly energizing year in the rear view mirror - GSF in 2022
key_quotes: The GSF has grown to 38 member organizations.
We aim to change how we build software, so there are zero harmful environmental effects.
summary: GSF 2022 annual report highlights: Global Summit, CarbonHack22, SCI v1.0, Practitioner Course, and Theory of Change.

people.title: Founder and Principal Researcher; Chair, Standards Working Group, GSF; Machine Learning

Adding more dimensions to the metric itself can provide more surfaces for people to come up with innovative solutions through which they can reduce the environmental impacts of their digital systems.

title: Bringing Academic Leadership to Accelerate Green Software Adoption--Meet Prof Javier Soriano of Universidad Politecnica de Madrid

people.name: Javier Soriano
people.title: Full Professor, School of Computer Engineering

title: Building a Global Tech Community for Climate Action--Meet ClimateAction.tech
key_quotes: We believe that everyone has a part to play in addressing the climate crisis.
Joining the GSF made sense so that we could extend our internal discussions to the larger enterprise community and other climate organizations.
summary: ClimateAction.tech, a 10,000+ member community, joins GSF to connect independent technologists with enterprise green software standards.
story_note: Large community (10K+ members) joining GSF; multi-org collaboration with Green Web Foundation, Mozilla Foundation; publishes Branch Magazine.

people.title: ESG Technology and Sustainable Technology Lead

people.name: Riccardo Marchiani
people.title: Head of Agile, Digital Innovation, and IT Group Excellence

Autostrade targeted 60 applications and obtained, on average, 15.1% of CO2 saved per application.

story_note: Multi-company collaboration (CAST + NTT DATA + UBS + Autostrade + Intesa San Paolo) with concrete metrics (15.1% CO2 savings, 60 apps). Shows full progression from specification to real-world results.

title: Building Sustainable Systems by Design--Meet Dr Karthik Vaidhyanathan of IIIT Hyderabad

people.name: Dr Karthik Vaidhyanathan
people.title: Assistant Professor, Software Engineering Research Center

key_quotes: Green software goes beyond reducing energy consumption or carbon footprint. Implementing green software principles means building software systems that meet the demands and key requirements while being environmentally conscious, societally considerate, and economically viable.
By embedding sustainability practices in the design process, we can ensure that we build truly sustainable systems.
summary: IIIT Hyderabad joins GSF with 350 IoT sensors on campus, collaborations with Qualcomm and Lloyds, and research on sustainable AI systems.
story_note: Multiple collaborations (Qualcomm, Lloyds, VU Amsterdam), PM Early Career Research Grant, 350 IoT sensors as a living lab, and research directly targeting SCI for AI.

title: Calculating Your Carbon Footprint: A Guide to Measuring Serverless App Emissions on AWS
key_quotes: Low per-request emissions can quickly scale to significant levels (305 kg of CO2 for 1M requests) for high-traffic applications.
The 'Reduce transmitted data' pattern can achieve approximately a 4% reduction in carbon emissions.
summary: NTT DATA applies SCI to measure serverless app emissions on AWS, finding 0.305g CO2 per request and demonstrating Green Software Patterns can reduce emissions by ~4%.
story_note: Concrete measurements with specific results (305kg CO2/1M requests, 4% reduction). NTT DATA building SCI calculator tool and testing Green Software Patterns.

title: Call to Action on Green Software: Establishing a Centre of Excellence
key_quotes: Green Software Engineering has the capacity to be self-sustaining, in the same way that organisations have previously adopted various methodologies and practices as a new default.
Part of our role should be to make our own evangelism unnecessary.
summary: Practical guidance on establishing a Centre of Excellence for green software within organisations, covering approaches from CoPs to project teams.

title: Call to Action: Spreading the Message of Green Software
key_quotes: Changing software development practices to be green is a major shift in thinking.
The power of grassroots change is often heavily underestimated.
summary: First in the CTA series, discussing how to drive top-down and bottom-up organisational change to adopt green software practices.

people.name: Navveen Balani
people.title: Chief Technologist, Technology Sustainability Innovation Group

summary: Recap of GSF panel on AI's environmental impact, featuring discussions on lifecycle sustainability, policy, culture, and the limitations of carbon-aware computing.
story_note: Multi-company expert perspectives (Accenture, Avanade, Intel, Stanford) with concrete data points and nuanced debate about whether AI can truly be green.

story_note: Flagship story: UBS + Microsoft + WattTime collaboration, first enterprise-scale carbon-aware implementation, progression from SDK development to production banking system, measurable CO2 savings.

people.title: Principal Software Engineering Manager, Azure SRE

You will pay a small premium to cut your carbon emissions roughly in half.

title: Carbon Hack 24: Expanding the Ecosystem of Software Measurement with Impact Framework
key_quotes: More and more clients want to measure their carbon emissions and reduce them. -- Ioannis Kolaxis, Accenture

Through IF, the sustainability world will have watchers. This is how we are going to change the world.

title: Carbon Hack 24: Redefining Software Measurement for Sustainability with Industry Leaders

people.name: Sanjay Podder
people.title: Managing Director for Sustainable Technology, Chair of GSF

As the first Singapore government agency to join the Green Software Foundation, IMDA is dedicated to promoting sustainable computing. -- Clifton Phua, IMDA
One cannot improve without measuring. -- Toru Shimogaki, NTT DATA
summary: Announcement of Carbon Hack 24, a $40K hackathon focused on Impact Framework, sponsored by eight industry leaders.

title: Carbon Hack 24: Where measurement meets innovation, and impact knows no bounds
key_quotes: How we measure software's environmental impact is more than a technicality; it determines the magnitude of change we can achieve.
summary: Early announcement of Carbon Hack 24 focusing on Impact Framework, with background on why software measurement matters.

title: That's a wrap - CarbonHack22 a big leap in carbon aware computing
key_quotes: The use case for Lowcarb showed carbon emissions reductions of 13% without any negative impact on the accuracy of the results.

story_note: Concrete hackathon results with measurable carbon reductions (13-24%). Multi-sponsor collaboration. First event of its kind, demonstrating community growth.

title: Carbon Hack 22
key_quotes: Carbon Awareness is one of the hottest topics in the green software space, and now with the Carbon Aware SDK, it's easier than ever to build a carbon aware application. -- Asim Hussain
summary: Announcement of CarbonHack22, the first carbon-aware software hackathon, sponsored by eight GSF members with $80K+ in prizes.

title: Celebrating the Graduation of the Carbon Aware SDK
key_quotes: Carbon aware software does more when energy is clean and less when it's dirty.
We started seeing evidence of how easy it is for any company to take steps towards greener software, without changing a single line of code.
summary: The Carbon Aware SDK reaches Graduated status, the first GSF software project to do so, with contributions from Avanade, Microsoft, UBS, and NTT DATA.
story_note: Full progression story: proposal -> development -> v1.0 -> graduation. Multi-company collaboration. Includes Vesta use case for wind turbine simulation. Shows SDK going from concept to industry standard.

title: Celebrating the Ratification of the Sustainable Organizational Framework for Technology (SOFT)
key_quotes: SOFT gives changemakers the structured approach they need to reduce carbon emissions from software operations while achieving their business objectives--embedding sustainable software practices into the DNA of the business.
Organizations had the tools, yet they struggled to use them systematically across their operations.
summary: SOFT ratified to help organizations embed green software practices systematically, with four global members piloting the framework.
story_note: Full progression story: need identified -> framework developed -> ratification -> piloting. Led by Pindy Bhullar (HSBC) and Sean O'Keefe (Microsoft). Four orgs already piloting.

title: Celebrating the Ratification of the Policy Radar
key_quotes: Knowing which laws are coming and when to engage in the policy making process is half of the battle.
summary: The Policy Radar is ratified, providing a collaborative public calendar of upcoming sustainability policy events and opportunities for GSF members.
story_note: Project progression from proposal (March 2024) to ratification. Led by Chris Adams. Fills unique gap in policy visibility for green software practitioners.

title: ChatGPT & Sustainability - Green Software Foundation Expert Perspectives
key_quotes: The carbon footprint is likely to be massive. But there is promising work reducing the number of parameters used with smarter training data set curation. -- Mathew Kropp, BCG X
Gartner predicts that by 2025, AI will consume more energy than the human workforce. -- Miranda Hill, Avanade
It will become necessary to require service vendors to disclose their environmental impact. -- Yusuke Kobayashi, NTT DATA
summary: Expert perspectives from BCG X, Avanade, NTT DATA, and Microsoft on the sustainability implications of ChatGPT and LLMs.
story_note: Multiple company perspectives (BCG X, Avanade, NTT DATA, Microsoft) on a hot topic. Shows diverse member motivations and concerns about AI's carbon footprint.

title: Cloud Computing: The Business Case for 100% Carbon Free Energy
key_quotes: 72% of software practitioners would be willing to pay more for cloud computing services that are Net-Zero and powered by 100% carbon-free energy.
The cloud already emits more global GHG emissions than the commercial airline industry.

Our next target is to develop a green software code of practice guide for our public agencies.
summary: GovTech Singapore shares its sustainability strategy, including moving 70% of government workloads to cloud and developing green software practices for public agencies.
story_note: Government agency adopting green software at national scale. Concrete targets (70% cloud migration). Developing green software code of practice for all public agencies. Unique government perspective.

key_quotes: Building a dark theme on your web site could help save energy on OLED screens!

people.title: Head of Research Group, Sustainable Software Engineering and DevOps

summary: Siemens joins GSF Steering Committee, sharing how they integrate Sustainable Software Engineering into their DevOps practice and DEGREE sustainability framework.
story_note: Major company (Siemens) joining as Steering Member with deep commitment. 90% of business enables sustainability. Personal motivation story from Carolin Rubner. Connects to SiGreen and DEGREE framework.

title: CTA: Success Factors, Measurements and Driving the Right Behaviour
key_quotes: There is almost a direct (albeit non-proportional) correlation between carbon reduction and cost reduction.
Our success factor here is our carbon intensity.

summary: HSBC joins GSF to embed green software principles, with net-zero operations target by 2030 and a focus on empowering technology staff.

title: Decarbonizing Software: How CAST applied the SCI Metric to Make a Difference

key_quotes: We see green software becoming a standard practice for all organizations and their development teams when devising new applications.

summary: Interview with Syngenio board member about their Green Software Design initiative, the Green Software Expertyzer tool, and the Green Software Design Label for certifying green software.
story_note: Syngenio created their own Green Software Expertyzer tool and Green Software Design Label before joining GSF. They have a dedicated team exploring Green Software Design since 2021. Concrete tools and outcomes.

title: Texas State University deems GSF SCI an effective metric to evaluate the carbon impact of software
key_quotes: The environmental impact of foundation models can be quantitatively measured and compared.
SCI is an effective metric to evaluate the carbon impact of different foundation models at the inference stage.
Carbon intensive models do not necessarily yield better quality. GPT-Neo 1.3B only consumes 27% of energy compared to GPT-J 6B.
summary: Texas State University study validates the SCI as an effective metric for evaluating carbon intensity of AI foundation models at inference, finding significant efficiency differences between models.
story_note: Academic validation of SCI with real results. Shows SCI applied to AI/foundation models with quantitative outcomes. GPT-Neo 1.3B uses only 27% energy of GPT-J 6B with similar quality. Key progression story for SCI adoption.

title: The Accountability Gap: Who Should Own Software's Environmental Impact?
key_quotes: Everyone agrees software needs to be more sustainable, but questions who has the power to make it happen.
summary: Announcement of GSF's consensus-building exercise at Green IO Paris with 800+ technologists to map accountability for software's environmental impact, using AI-supported methodology.

key_quotes: Instead of measuring how much energy an application consumes, we should test adding energy events to see how the application behaves and then drive change to improve its reaction to events that make it less green.
summary: Proposes applying chaos engineering principles to sustainability via 'carbon monkeys' that inject energy inefficiency events into applications to test and improve their carbon resilience.

title: The Green Software Foundation and World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) Collaborate to Advance Adoption of Web Sustainability Measurement
key_quotes: Almost all of us use the web daily, and like everything else, we need to make using it more sustainable. By defining a standard for measuring website emissions, we make it easier for people to request greener digital services.
summary: Announcement of GSF-W3C collaboration to develop the SCI for Web standard, with Green Web Foundation brokering the partnership. Includes Impact Framework templates and shared educational materials.
story_note: Two major standards bodies collaborating (GSF and W3C) brokered by a member (Green Web Foundation). Development of SCI for Web specification. Three organisations working together.

title: The Green Software Foundation and SustainableArchitectures.org Partner to Advance Sustainable Digital Architecture and Green Software Practices
key_quotes: By connecting IASA's architecture frameworks with GSF's measurement standards like the Software Carbon Intensity specification, we're giving architects the tools to quantify impact and make sustainability decisions based on data, not guesswork.
summary: Partnership announcement between GSF and SustainableArchitectures.org to integrate sustainability into enterprise architecture through shared frameworks, certifications, and ESG-aligned reference architectures.

title: Meet Our Steering Committee: Microsoft
key_quotes: The biggest thing that we did was a commitment to reduce emissions by 55% by 2030. It gets buried in the headlines, but it's actually the thing that keeps people awake at night. - Jeff Sandquist
Satya Nadella doubled down on our sustainability commitment in 2019. He said, as large as Microsoft was, we can't do it alone. We need to collaborate with every other organization out there.
summary: Origin story of the GSF told by Microsoft's Jeff Sandquist, covering how Microsoft's developer relations team identified the green software knowledge gap and how multiple organisations converged on the same mission.
story_note: Foundational origin story of the GSF. Multiple companies (Microsoft, Accenture, Thoughtworks, GitHub) independently converging on green software. Jeff Sandquist's motivation and Microsoft's sustainability commitments as catalyst.

title: The Green Software Foundation Joins the UK Government Digital Sustainability Alliance (GDSA) to Shape Industry Standards
key_quotes: This partnership represents a pivotal moment where green software principles move from industry practice to government policy.
The GDSA is delighted to welcome the Green Software Foundation into the Alliance.
summary: GSF joins the UK Government Digital Sustainability Alliance to support DEFRA and the wider UK government in meeting digital sustainability commitments, contributing to AI, Scope 3, and circular economy working groups.
story_note: Government adoption of GSF standards and tools. Testing Carbon Aware SDK and Impact Framework in government environments. Shows progression from industry standards to government policy.

title: The Green Software Foundation Releases Alpha Version of Software Carbon Intensity Specification for Comment
key_quotes: The per R is the secret sauce to the SCI. It is what makes the SCI into a tool that works for every software domain, every use case, and every person.
The only way to reduce an SCI score is to use less hardware, use less energy, or be more carbon aware. Lower SCI scores are better than higher scores and reaching zero is impossible.
summary: Launch announcement for the alpha SCI specification, explaining the formula (SCI = ((E * I) + M) per R), how it differs from a carbon footprint, and why it focuses on reduction over offsetting.
story_note: Major milestone in SCI progression - alpha release for public comment. Consensus across 20+ member organisations. Key moment in the SCI journey from concept to standard.

title: The GSF Endorses the AI Environmental Impacts Act
key_quotes: AI energy use could balloon to more than 85-134 terawatt hours by 2027, as much power as the Netherlands consumes annually.
summary: GSF's endorsement of the AI Environmental Impacts Act, explaining how the bill's requirements for AI environmental reporting align with GSF projects like SCI, Impact Framework, and Green Software Patterns.
story_note: GSF's first major policy endorsement. Shows how GSF tools (SCI, Impact Framework) would directly benefit from proposed legislation. Policy-to-practice connection.

title: The GSF Global Summit is Back!
summary: Announcement of the 2024 GSF Global Summit with in-person events across 10 cities worldwide hosted by member organisations, including London, Munich, Sao Paulo, Tokyo, and Singapore.
story_note: Shows scale of GSF community - 10+ member organisations hosting simultaneous events across 6 countries. Demonstrates global reach and member engagement.

title: The Open Source Approach is Revolutionizing the Business World - Meet Christopher Howard, Lead Open Source Program Manager at EPAM Systems, Inc.
key_quotes: Sustainability has become essential to that conversation and is no longer a 'nice to have' but instead is a 'must have'.

Reusing code, both open and inner source, has significant business value. Through reusing that code, you can confidently say that you're not expending the same amount of energy to write something entirely new.
summary: Interview with EPAM's OSPO lead about how the company integrates green software into client offerings, launched a sustainability hackathon using GSF tools, and sees open source as a driver of sustainability.
story_note: EPAM launched a Sustainability Hackathon using SCI and Carbon Aware SDK. Concrete adoption story with 60,000 employees. Shows how open source practices naturally align with sustainability. COP26 attendance as catalyst.

title: Our Theory of Change -- Defining the strategy for the GSF
key_quotes: Our mission and vision tell us the place we want to reach, our Theory Of Change tells us how we will get there. - Asim Hussain
Change how we build software, so there are zero harmful environmental effects.
summary: Defines the GSF's strategic framework across three pillars - Knowledge, Tech Culture, and Tooling - explaining how each drives the vision of zero harmful environmental effects from software.

title: UBS Joins Green Software Foundation as a Steering Member
key_quotes: The work we plan to undertake with the GSF is about adopting a new paradigm for software development -- one that shifts towards greener outcomes and lower carbon emissions from our digital ecosystem.

As early adopters of the cloud within the financial services industry, we have also made progress in our ability to calculate our carbon emissions as we systematically move from on-premise solutions into the cloud.
summary: UBS joins as steering member, describing plans to shift software development towards greener outcomes, share cloud migration carbon measurement learnings, and scale green practices across its developer community.
story_note: Major financial institution joining as steering member. UBS has concrete cloud migration carbon measurement experience to share. Plans for MVPs and pilot projects. Financial services adoption angle.

title: Understanding Energy Market Trends at the Layer Below the Internet Stack
key_quotes: Renewables and batteries have effectively created a pincer movement on fossil fuels.
The question isn't if fossil fuels get kicked off the grids, it is about when. And in the 2020's when it comes to climate, speed is justice.
summary: Educational article explaining energy market fundamentals for software developers, covering how nuclear, coal, gas, renewables, and batteries interact economically to shape the grid.

story_note: RAI Institute brings AI governance and conformity assessment expertise. Identified nine metrics including GHG, energy, and water consumption for AI. Bridges responsible AI and green AI.

title: Upgrading to .NET 8: Inside the Carbon Aware SDK v1.4
key_quotes: By integrating new features such as the carbon metrics exporter and improving compatibility with tools like Prometheus and Grafana, the SDK is better equipped to help developers monitor and reduce carbon emissions.
summary: Technical deep-dive by NTT/NTT DATA engineers on upgrading the Carbon Aware SDK to .NET 8, including new carbon metrics exporter for Prometheus/Grafana visualisation and Kubernetes green dashboards.
story_note: NTT DATA engineers actively contributing to Carbon Aware SDK development. Shows real-world Kubernetes carbon monitoring dashboards. Practical implementation with Prometheus/Grafana. Multi-company open-source collaboration.

title: Automated SCI Measurements with the Green Metrics Tool - A Use Case for Assessing Software Carbon Footprint
key_quotes: The SCI provides an easily digestible metric to get a first glimpse at your application's energy and carbon profile. We can democratize access to this vital metric using open-source tools.
summary: Case study showing the Green Metrics Tool automating SCI calculations for Wagtail CMS (0.02 gCO2e/page) and Nextcloud Talk (0.15 gCO2e/message), with reproducible benchmarking on reference hardware.
story_note: Concrete SCI measurements with real numbers: Wagtail at 0.02 gCO2e/page, Nextcloud Talk at 0.15 gCO2e/message. Open-source tooling that automates SCI. Shows SCI working in practice with reproducible results.

title: Why the GSF Is Participating in the GHG Protocol Scope 2 Consultation
key_quotes: Carbon awareness connects directly to Scope 2 emissions. When software operations shift based on grid carbon intensity at specific times and locations, developers can minimize their environmental impact.
The GSF strongly supports clarifying Scope 2 as emissions from generation physically connected to the reporter's value chain.
summary: Explains GSF's participation in the GHG Protocol Scope 2 consultation, advocating for granular, time- and location-sensitive emissions data that enables carbon-aware computing.
story_note: GSF influencing global carbon accounting standards (GHG Protocol). Shows how SCI learnings inform policy positions. Connection between software carbon awareness and Scope 2 accounting.

title: Why We Are on the Cusp of a New Era of Carbon-Efficient Software
key_quotes: Ask any of the 27 million software developers writing code worldwide to quantify the carbon impact of their software, and what's their likely response? A shrug of the shoulders.
While the hardware consumes the energy, it's the software that triggers that consumption.
